meanings.definition: One of the bony or cartilaginous segments composing the spinal column, consisting in some lower vertebrates of several distinct elements which never become united, and in higher vertebrates having a short more or less cylindrical body whose ends articulate by pads of elastic or cartilaginous tissue with those of adjacent vertebrae and a bony arch that encloses the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the vertebra on the X-ray to show where the injury occurred.
meanings.sent2: The vertebrae in the spine help support the body and protect the spinal cord.
meanings.sent3: The vertebra decided to take a break from supporting the spine and went on strike.
meanings.sent4: The vertebrae of the team worked together seamlessly, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The vertebra, like a sturdy pillar, stood strong against the weight of the body.
